title: Part A (i)
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not indicate that separase is most active at the metaphase-anaphase transition OR at the start of anaphase.
The response indicates that separase is most active at the metaphase-anaphase transition OR at the start of anaphase.

title: Part A (ii)
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not indicate that cells form complexes with different combinations of cyclins and cyclin-dependent (cdk) kinases or that the combinations of the two proteins in the complexes induce the cells to move to different stages of the cell cycle.

The response indicates that cells form complexes with different combinations of cyclins and cyclin-dependent (cdk) kinases and that the combinations of the two proteins in the complexes induce the cells to move to different stages of the cell cycle.

title: Part B (i)
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not indicate that an independent variable is the cell lines OR the concentrations of Sepin-1.
The response indicates that an independent variable is the cell lines OR the concentrations of Sepin-1.

title: Part B (ii)
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.

title: Part C (i)
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not indicate that the greater the concentration of separase in the cells, the more sensitive the cells are to Sepin-1 OR that less Sepin-1 is required to kill cells with a greater concentration of separase.

The response indicates that the greater the concentration of separase in the cells, the more sensitive the cells are to Sepin-1 OR that less Sepin-1 is required to kill cells with a greater concentration of separase.

title: Part D
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not indicate that if the compound is effective, the rate at which the cells are cycling should decrease because Sepin-1 should decrease the amount of active separase in the cells. If the cells are cycling less frequently, fewer cells should be in metaphase.

The response indicates that if the compound is effective, the rate at which the cells are cycling should decrease because Sepin-1 should decrease the amount of active separase in the cells. If the cells are cycling less frequently, fewer cells should be in metaphase.
